Package ohos.event.notification

Class NotificationSlot

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.event.notification.NotificationSlot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public final class NotificationSlot
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Defines a public notification theme, which is a collection of features including notification tone, vibration, lock screen display, and level. You can associate this class with an application, so that all notifications released by the application have the features of the notification theme.

    An application can be associated with one or more NotificationSlot instances.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Notification#ANS

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface ohos.utils.Sequenceable

        Sequenceable.Producer<T>

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int LEVEL_DEFAULT
      Indicates that the notification function is enabled and notifications are displayed on the notification panel, with no banner but with a prompt tone.
      static int LEVEL_HIGH
      Indicates that the notification function is enabled and notifications are displayed on the notification panel, with a banner and a prompt tone.
      static int LEVEL_LOW
      Indicates that the notification function is enabled and notifications are displayed on the notification panel, with no banner or prompt tone.
      static int LEVEL_MIN
      Indicates that the notification function is enabled but notifications are not displayed on the notification panel, with no banner or prompt tone.
      static int LEVEL_NONE
      Indicates that the notification function is disabled.
      static int LEVEL_UNDEFINED
      Indicates that the user does not define an level.
      static Sequenceable.Producer<NotificationSlot> PRODUCER
      Creates a NotificationSlot instance from a Parcel.

      A constructor used to initialize the ID, name, and level of a NotificationSlot object.

        public static final int LEVEL_UNDEFINED
        Indicates that the user does not define an level.

        This is a reserved constant. Do not associate it with any notification.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NotificationSlot

        public NotificationSlot​(String id,
                        String name,
                        int level)
        A constructor used to initialize the ID, name, and level of a NotificationSlot object.
        Parameters:
        id - Specifies the ID of the NotificationSlot object. The ID must be unique and its length must not exceed 1000 characters (the excessive part is automatically truncated).
        name - Specifies the name of the NotificationSlot object. The name must be visible to users and its length must not exceed 1000 characters (the excessive part is automatically truncated).
        level - Specifies the level of the NotificationSlot object, which determines the notification display effect. The value can be LEVEL_NONE, LEVEL_MIN, LEVEL_LOW, LEVEL_DEFAULT, or LEVEL_HIGH.
        Since:
        1

    • Method Detail

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel​(int level)
        Sets the level of a NotificationSlot object.

        setLevel(int level) must be set before the NotificationHelper#addNotificationSlot(NotificationSlot) method is called. Otherwise, the settings will not take effect.

        Parameters:
        level - Specifies the level of the NotificationSlot object, which determines the notification display effect. The value can be LEVEL_NONE, LEVEL_MIN, LEVEL_LOW, LEVEL_DEFAULT, or LEVEL_HIGH.
        Since:
        1

      • setName

        public void setName​(String name)
        Sets the name of a NotificationSlot object.

        The setting of setName(String) is effective regardless of whether a NotificationSlot object has been created by NotificationHelper#addNotificationSlot(NotificationSlot).

        Parameters:
        name - Specifies the name of the NotificationSlot object. The name is visible to users, and its length must not exceed 1000 characters (the excessive part is automatically truncated).
        Since:
        1

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription​(String description)
        Sets the description for a NotificationSlot object.

        The setting of setDescription(String) is effective regardless of whether a NotificationSlot object has been created by NotificationHelper#addNotificationSlot(NotificationSlot).

        Parameters:
        description - Describes the NotificationSlot object. The description is visible to users and its length must not exceed 1000 characters (the excessive part is automatically truncated).
        Since:
        1

      • enableBadge

        public void enableBadge​(boolean isShowBadge)
        Sets whether to display application icon badges (digits or dots in the corner of the application icon) on the home screen after a notification is received.

        enableBadge(boolean) must be set before the NotificationHelper#addNotificationSlot(NotificationSlot) method is called. Otherwise, the settings will not take effect.

        Parameters:
        isShowBadge - Specifies whether to display the application icon badge. If the value is true, the application icon badge is enabled; if the value is false, the application icon badge is disabled.
        Since:
        1

      • enableBypassDnd

        public void enableBypassDnd​(boolean bypassDnd)
        Sets whether to bypass Do not disturb (DND) mode in the system.

        The setting of enableBypassDnd(boolean) takes effect only when the Allow interruptions function is enabled for an application in system notification settings.

        Parameters:
        bypassDnd - Specifies whether to bypass DND mode for an application. If the value is true, DND mode is bypassed; if the value is false, DND mode is not bypassed.
        Since:
        1

      • setEnableVibration

        public void setEnableVibration​(boolean vibration)
        Sets whether to enable vibration when a notification is received.

        setEnableVibration(boolean) must be set before the NotificationHelper#addNotificationSlot(NotificationSlot) method is called. Otherwise, the settings will not take effect.

        Parameters:
        vibration - Indicates whether to enable vibration when a notification is received. If the value is true, vibration is enabled; if the value is false, vibration is disabled.
        Since:
        1

      • setLockscreenVisibleness

        public void setLockscreenVisibleness​(int visibleness)
        Sets whether and how to display notifications on the lock screen.

        This method specifies different effects for displaying notifications on the lock screen in order to protect user privacy.

        The setting takes effect only when the lock screen notifications function is enabled for an application in system notification settings.

        Parameters:
        visibleness - Specifies the notification display effect on the lock screen, which can be set to NotificationRequest#VISIBLENESS_TYPE_PUBLIC, NotificationRequest#VISIBLENESS_TYPE_PRIVATE, or NotificationRequest#VISIBLENESS_TYPE_SECRET.
        Since:
        1

      • setSound

        public void setSound​(Uri sound)
        Sets a prompt tone for a NotificationSlot object, which will be played after a notification is received.

        setSound(Uri) must be set before the NotificationHelper#addNotificationSlot(NotificationSlot) method is called. Otherwise, the settings will not take effect.

        Parameters:
        sound - Specifies the path for the prompt tone.
        Since:
        1

      • setEnableLight

        public void setEnableLight​(boolean isLightEnabled)
        Specifies whether to enable the notification light when a notification is received on the device, provided that this device has a notification light.

        setEnableLight(boolean) must be set before the NotificationHelper#addNotificationSlot(NotificationSlot) method is called. Otherwise, the settings will not take effect.

        Parameters:
        isLightEnabled - Specifies whether to enable the pulse notification light. The value true indicates to enable the notification light, and the value false indicates not to enable it.
        Since:
        1

      • setLedLightColor

        public void setLedLightColor​(int color)
        Sets the color of the notification light to flash when a notification is received on the device, provided that this device has a notification light and setEnableLight(boolean) is called with the value true.

        setLedLightColor(int) must be set before the NotificationHelper#addNotificationSlot(NotificationSlot) method is called. Otherwise, the settings will not take effect.

        Parameters:
        color - Indicates the color of the notification light.
        Since:
        1

      • setSlotGroup

        public void setSlotGroup​(String groupId)
        Binds a NotificationSlot object to a specified NotificationSlotGroup.

        setSlotGroup(String) must be called before the NotificationHelper#addNotificationSlot(NotificationSlot) method is called. Otherwise, this method will not take effect.

        Parameters:
        groupId - Indicates the ID of the NotificationSlotGroup object to bind, which must have been created by calling NotificationHelper#addNotificationSlotGroup(NotificationSlotGroup).
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        NotificationSlotGroup

      • setVibrationStyle

        public void setVibrationStyle​(long[] vibrationValues)
        Sets the vibration style for notifications in this NotificationSlot.

        If an empty array or null is passed to this method, the system then calls setEnableVibration(boolean) with the input parameter set to false. If a valid value is passed to this method, the system calls setEnableVibration(boolean) with the input parameter set to true. This method takes effect only before NotificationHelper#addNotificationSlot(NotificationSlot) is called.

        Parameters:
        vibrationValues - Indicates the vibration style to set.
        Since:
        4

      • getVibrationStyle

        public long[] getVibrationStyle​()
        Obtains the vibration style of notifications in this NotificationSlot.
        Returns:
        Returns the vibration style of this NotificationSlot.
        Since:
        4

      • marshalling

        public boolean marshalling​(Parcel out)
        Marshals a NotificationSlot object into a Parcel.

        A process can call the unmarshalling(ohos.utils.Parcel) method to unmarshal a NotificationSlot object from a Parcel to implement inter-process communication (IPC).

        Specified by:
        marshalling in interface Sequenceable
        Parameters:
        out - Indicates the Parcel object for marshalling.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the marshalling is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • toString

        public String toString​()
        Description copied from class: Object
        Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method.

        The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of: 

         getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the object.
        Since:
        4
